item.title: Visualizing Covid data using animated graphs
item.description: Animated Coivd Graphs Although it was a bad year for the world, 2020 was a great year for data visualisation with visualisations of both Covid-19 and US Election inescapable. Some great examples can be seen here and here

item.title: Introduction to Network Analysis with R
item.description: Konigsberg Bridges Network analysis has its origins in the Königsberg Bridge problem. The problem was to find a walk through the city that would cross each of the 7 bridges exactly once. In 1736 Euler studied a way to solve this problem mathematically.

item.title: Visualizing Strava Activities with R
item.description: Strava is an internet service for tracking human exercise which incorporates social network features - it is sometimes referred to as “Facebook for cyclist”. Strava provides tools for analysing activities and relative performance - however there are no native Strava tools to visualise activities.

item.title: Working with Shapefiles in R
item.description: R and the ggplot library provide an extremely flexible framework for the plotting and visualisation of data. Plots can be extended to not just traditional line and bar plots but also to geospatial visualisations (or choropleths)

item.title: Sentiment Analysis of Tweets to Irish Banks
item.description: Analysing sentiment based on a text string is pretty classic introductory problem in the field of Machine Learning. The idea is seductively simple - by analysing the data of publically available tweets is it possible to discern or extrapolate some additional analysis.

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: Business: General business books covering everything from strategy to scandals: The Innovator’s Dilemma (Clayton Christensen) Essential reading. Thought provoking book on why despite doing all the right things your business can still end up being overtaken by disrupters.

item.title: About
item.description: “The pure and simple truth is rarely pure and never simple” A mixture of pretty plots and statistical analysis. Just for fun.

item.title: Heatmaps
item.description: Visualizing run and cycle activities. Trieste Dublin Galway
